name: petulantly
content:
Add to word list

in a way that is petulant (= easily annoyed and rude, like a child): "Well, he didn't invite me to his party so I'm certainly not inviting him to mine!" she said petulantly. He stamped a foot petulantly. See
petulant
More examplesFewer examples"The bolt keeps breaking and I can't figure out why," said the frustrated man, a little petulantly.He shouted petulantly at a boy who was carving a word on an almond tree.The player had just petulantly hurled the ball at the referee.
